Tim Abbott said:

(But you can of course scroll the sidebar elsewhere, so there's no guarantee it stays in that state).

This is my sidebar while browsing #design > navigate to search result
2023-01-26-011435_551x172_scrot.png
The topic was visible in the left sidebar when I clicked it from my recent topics view. But after I pressed j to move the cursor down in my message view, it suddenly becomes not visible. I never did any scrolling in the left sidebar.

I suppose this is because when one normally consumes the unreads/recent topics, the auto-scroll is triggered. But since the #design > navigate to search result is not the most recent in the unread topic list, it somehow becomes pushed away from the view.

I see, seems like a race. I think we have an ongoing engineering project to try to deal with races in the sidebar better, and I'll try to keep track of this potential class of race while we're doing that.
